snippet: The iBooks Store and iTunes Movies were closed six months after they began in China, which had been more welcoming of Apple than other tech companies.
abstract: Apple, previously spared resistance from China over its products and market share, is now facing regulatory headwinds from country that could limit expansion; China has shut down iBooks Store and iTunes Movies services in country; company has looked to China as its iPhone sales weaken in United States.

byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and JANE PERLEZ

lead_paragraph: The iBooks Store and iTunes Movies were closed six months after they began in China, which had been more welcoming of Apple than other tech companies.

headline.main: Apple Services Shut Down in China in Startling About-Face
headline.print_headline: Immune No More, Apple Under Scrutiny in China

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television (China)
